abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Social Investment Fund
            Project (ASIF II) aims to assist the Government of Armenia
            in its continuing endeavor to improve living standards of
            the lower income groups among the Armenian population and
            strengthen institutions at the local level. There are three
            project components. The first rehabilitates small-scale
            social and economic infrastructure by financing
            micro-projects 1) to rehabilitate or upgrade schools, health
            clinics, water supply systems, sanitation works, irrigation,
            and other infrastructure; and 2) to repair school heating
            systems. This component also funds school furniture
            purchases, provides capacity building and technical
            assistance to local contractors and implementing agencies;
            and finances consulting services for micro-project design
            and supervision. The second component finances institutional
            strengthening at the local level, and builds capacity and
            supplies technical assistance to local governments and
            community-based organizations. The third component furnishes
            institutional support to the Armenian Social Investment Fund
            by financing special studies, assessments, reviews, vehicles
            and equipment, and project administration and management as
            well as annual financial, procurement, and technical audits.
